title: LME aluminium cash offer rises to $2,916/t as opening stocks hold steady at 519,600t
summary: LME aluminium cash and forward prices firmed on December 23, with the cash offer rising to USD 2,916/t while LME opening stocks remained unchanged at 519,600 tonnes; 3-month forward bids also increased modestly amid firming physical bids and steady warehouse inventories. The report notes parallel gains for near-dated contracts and provides regional reference prices and an assessment of alumina (Platts) as supportive context for near-term market strength.[2]

title: Aluminum price falls to one-month low in wider commodity slump
summary: Aluminum led base metals lower amid a broader commodity selloff, dropping as much as 1.6% to $2,526/t on the LME—the lowest since Nov. 14—as traders reacted to macro data and Fed-rate expectations; the piece highlights rising Chinese output and strong exports as contributors to near-term weakness while some banks remain bullish on longer-term price upside.[3]

title: Aluminum - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: Trading Economics reports aluminum prices near three-year highs in late December, with prices around USD 2,942–2,947/t on Dec 23 and a month-to-month increase for December; the page aggregates recent price moves, historical highs, and short commentary on supply concerns and China’s policies impacting capacity.[1]

title: Aluminum Holds Near 3-Year High
summary: A Trading Economics news item notes aluminum futures in the UK near USD 2,950/t in December—close to the highest in over three years—driven by worries over low supply and China’s emphasis on preventing overcapacity, which is supporting prices and an 18% year-to-date gain.[4]

title: Aluminum prices remain elevated near three-year highs amid global supply tightness
summary: This article reports that aluminum prices are holding near three-year highs, attributing the strength to global supply tightness, tighter Chinese output controls, decreased exports, and broader production challenges that are limiting available metal and supporting prices.[7]

title: Steel - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: Steel prices rose to 3,084 CNY/T on December 24, 2025, up 0.33% from the previous day. Over the past month, prices have fallen 0.42%, and are down 5.08% compared to the same time last year. Steel rebar futures in China were at CNY 3,085 per tonne, set to close the year around 7% lower amid soft demand for ferrous metals.

title: HRC Steel - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: HRC Steel traded flat at 908 USD/T on December 23, 2025, with a slight decline to 907.02 USD/T, down 0.11% from the previous day. Over the past month, prices have fallen 0.55%, but remain 25.11% higher than a year ago.

title: US Long Steel Prices Supported by Tariffs and Production Outages in Late 2025
summary: US long steel prices are supported by Section 232 import tariffs reducing imports and domestic mill autumn production outages, tightening supply. Imports of long steel products dropped from 1.1 million tonnes monthly to around 800,000 tonnes in September and October. The analysis anticipates improved demand from construction and automotive sectors, potentially boosted by Federal Reserve interest rate cuts.

title: US scrap trends outlook: December 2025
summary: US ferrous scrap market sentiment is neutral, with the Trend Indicator at 47.9, signaling a modest 1% price decline month-over-month. Uncertainty persists due to mill outages, weak finished steel pricing, and stagnant economic activity, with sellers mildly optimistic and buyers bearish.

title: Nucor Plate Group adds $40/ton to plate prices
summary: Nucor Plate Group has increased plate prices by $40/ton. This update appears amid latest news on steel market trends, including global steel production falling to a near two-year low in November and weekly raw steel mill output ticking lower.

title: US raw steel production is down 1.6 percent - week 52, 2025
summary: US domestic raw steel production for the week ending December 20, 2025, was 1.725 million net tons at a capacity utilization rate of 76.3 percent, down 1.6 percent from the prior week. This represents a 3.6 percent increase compared to the same week in 2024. Year-to-date production through December 20, 2025, reached 87.606 million net tons at 76.8 percent capacity utilization, up 3.4 percent from the previous year.

title: China steel group urges domestic pricing in iron ore contracts
summary: China's top steel industry group, the China Iron and Steel Association, urged the state-backed China Mineral Resources Group to use domestic price benchmarks in iron ore supply talks with major miners like BHP and Rio Tinto. A new port-side spot price index should serve as a core reference for long-term contracts to shift pricing power toward China. This reflects ongoing efforts to counter USD-dominated benchmarks amid negotiations for next year's supply deals.

title: Clarification of holiday pricing schedule for Turkey flat steel, slab assessments
summary: Fastmarkets clarified its holiday pricing calendar for Turkey flat steel and slab assessments, noting no publications on December 26 due to a UK public holiday, with updates resuming December 29. This affects prices like hot-rolled coil import CFR main port Turkey and related assessments. The updated calendar is available on their site.

title: The Global Steel Industry 2025: At a Pivotal Crossroads
summary: The steel industry in 2025 faces transformation through AI, hydrogen-based production, automation, and sustainability initiatives like green steel. Green steel demand surges in construction and automotive sectors, driven by low-carbon methods using recycled waste and alternative fuels. Hydrogen emerges as a key clean alternative in Direct Reduced Iron processes, complemented by efficient recycling for a circular economy.

title: Reflecting on 2025: Circularity, Sustainability and Transformation for Steel Manufacturing
summary: As 2025 ends, New Zealand's steel sector advances with the Electric Arc Furnace at New Zealand Steel for lower-carbon production from recycled scrap. Initiatives include digital material passports for lifecycle traceability and a national hub for advanced manufacturing and circular innovation. Circularity proves steel's strength in sustainable construction through emission reductions and material reuse.

title: Materials genome accelerator of Iran's steel revolution
summary: Mobarakeh Steel Group emphasizes innovation for global competition, focusing on sustainability through green steel, clean processes, emission reductions, and circular economy. The company advances digital transition to smart factories and develops advanced high-value steels for automotive, renewable energy, and lightweight structures. Structural changes are essential beyond mere production volume increases.

title: Breakthrough Technology Conference 2025
summary: The worldsteel Breakthrough Technology Conference 2025 in Singapore facilitated networking and exploration of technologies for steel industry decarbonization. Presentations on breakthrough options are available for download. It provided a platform for the technical community to exchange ideas on sustainable steel production.

title: Copper - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: Copper fell to 5.50 USD/Lbs on December 24, 2025, down 0.21% from the previous day. Over the past month, prices have risen 9.52%, and are up 35.92% year-over-year. US copper futures reached $5.5 per pound amid supply concerns and potential tariffs on copper inputs by US President Trump.

title: Latest updates on metals prices worldwide at 0200 GMT, Dec. 24
summary: London Stock Exchange Group reports copper at 5.48 USD at 0200 GMT on December 24. Other metals include iron ore at 106.95 USD, palladium at 2,004.50 USD, and platinum at 2,359.20 USD. This update provides snapshot pricing for global commodities.

title: Copper Closes in on $12,000-a-Ton Mark
summary: Copper prices have surged more than a third due to trade dislocations and mine outages. The market is closing in on $12,000 per ton amid ongoing supply challenges. Banks predict further gains in the copper market.

title: Copper hits record high above $12,000 a ton on weaker dollar and supply outlook
summary: Benchmark three-month copper on the London Metal Exchange reached a record $12,038.50 per metric ton. Prices were up 0.8% at $12,023.50 by 1109 GMT, driven by a weaker dollar and tight supply outlook. This marks a significant high for the commodity.

title: Copper Hits $12,000 a Ton. Time to Mine Freeport-McMoRan for More Profits
summary: Copper prices hit an all-time high of around $12,000 per ton on the LME, fueled by Trump's tariff threats, supply constraints, and demand from EVs, renewables, and AI. Freeport-McMoRan, up 34% YTD, benefits from higher prices and strong operations at mines like Morenci and Cerro Verde. Analysts rate it a Buy with a $49.11 target.

title: Copper hits all-time high today: Will Trump's tariffs and mine disruptions keep prices soaring despite slowing China demand
summary: Copper prices soared above $12,000 per ton due to US tariffs and mining disruptions. This occurs despite slowing demand from China. The all-time high reflects persistent supply issues and trade tensions.

title: As copper reaches record $12K per ton, everyday products poised ...
summary: Copper prices surged past $12,000 per metric ton for the first time, setting a record on the London Metal Exchange. This milestone triggers implications for everyday products. The rally highlights strong market dynamics.

title: COMEX Copper Inventories Hit Record High, LME Copper Fluctuated and Closed Higher Overnight [SMM Copper Morning Meeting Minutes]
summary: Report notes COMEX copper inventories reached a record high while LME and SHFE inventories also rose, and LME copper prices briefly broke through the $12,000/mt level before retreating; the item summarizes recent mine and project updates and expects continued upside in copper prices amid tight supply and supportive macro factors.[1]

title: Copper price tops $12,000 for first time on tariffs, supply woes
summary: Article reports copper exceeded $12,000/tonne for the first time, attributing the surge to mine disruptions, tariffs and expectations of rising demand from electrification and AI data centres; analysts warn of potential structural deficits beginning in 2026 due to slow project delivery and limited capacity additions.[2]

title: Copper's Structural Supercycle: Why $12,000 Is Just the Beginning
summary: Opinion/analysis piece arguing geopolitical shocks, tariffs and accelerating demand tied to electrification and AI are creating a long-term 'supercycle' for copper, citing forecasts of a 2026 refined-copper deficit and multi-year price appreciation scenarios from major banks.[3]

title: Copper Hits $12,000 a Ton. Time to Mine Freeport-McMoRan for More Profits
summary: Investment-focused article highlights that copper's rally to $12,000/ton is boosting margins for major producers like Freeport-McMoRan, while noting production disruptions at Grasberg have constrained output; the piece discusses company-level production guidance and where earnings may benefit from higher prices.[4]

title: Marimaca Copper: Low-Cost Path to Production in Chile
summary: Profile of Marimaca Copper describing its advance toward production with a low-capital oxide project in Chile; the article places the project in context of high late-2025 copper prices and a tight supply outlook, noting expected construction and first-production timelines that could add capacity in the near term.[5]

title: Copper Closes in on $12,000-a-Ton Mark
summary: Coverage of the price surge toward $12,000/ton, emphasizing analyst warnings that structural deficits may begin in 2026 as demand from energy transition and technology accelerates while supply faces outages and trade disruptions.[6]

title: Nickel - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: Nickel price fell to 15,799.25 USD/T on December 24, 2025, down 0.79% from the previous day, though it also rose to 15,840.25 USD/T up 1.28% in another update. Over the past month, prices have risen between 5.89% and 7.54%. Recent news includes nickel hitting a 5-week high on December 22 at 14,978 USD/T.

title: On December 24, the SMM #1 refined nickel price was ...
summary: The SMM #1 refined nickel price reached 126,400–134,000 yuan/mt on December 24, with an average of 130,200 yuan/mt. This marks an increase of 4,950 yuan/mt from the previous day. The rise reflects recent market momentum in nickel pricing.

title: LME nickel hits near two-month high on supply Curbs, fed rate-cut hopes
summary: LME nickel futures rose by US$473 per tonne to US$15,276 per tonne, while the spot price gained US$472 to US$15,087 per tonne. The rally, marking the fourth consecutive gain, is driven by supply curbs and hopes for Fed rate cuts. Prices jumped sharply on December 24.

title: Indonesia releases benchmark prices for nickel ore in December ...
summary: Indonesia set the benchmark price for nickel ore in December Period II at US$14,599.33/wmt, down 0.46% from Period I's US$14,666.67/wmt. Detailed FOB prices by grade show slight increases, such as NI 1.6% at US$25.81/wmt. This adjustment reflects ongoing market dynamics for nickel ore.

title: Indonesia may slash nickel output to steady prices
summary: Indonesia, the world’s top nickel producer, is proposing a 34% reduction in nickel production to 250 million tonnes in 2026 from this year's roughly 379 million tonnes to curb oversupply and support prices. The plan, outlined in the government's 2026 Work Plan and Budget, aims to address a global surplus projected at 209 million tonnes in 2025, potentially widening to 261 million tonnes next year with Indonesia contributing 65%. Analysts note this could help nickel prices recover toward $18,000-$20,000 per tonne amid declining ore grades and imports.

title: LME nickel hits near two-month high on supply curbs, Fed rate-cut hopes
summary: LME nickel futures rose sharply by US$473 per tonne to US$15,276 per tonne, with the spot price gaining US$472 to US$15,087 per tonne, marking a near two-month high. The rally is attributed to supply curbs and hopes for Fed rate cuts. Prices climbed on December 24 amid these factors influencing the nickel market.

title: This nickel stock leaves oversold area, reaches a new resistance
summary: Analysts highlight positive sentiment for a nickel stock due to the Indonesian government's decision to cut the 2026 nickel production target to 250 million tonnes. The stock has exited an oversold area and is heading toward a new resistance level. This reflects market reactions to production restraint measures aimed at stabilizing prices.

title: This nickel stock exits the oversold zone, heading toward a new resistance
summary: Ina Sekuritas analysts recommend a nickel mining and processing company, PT Merdeka Battery Materials Tbk (MBMA), following its exit from an oversold zone toward new resistance. The positive outlook stems from Indonesia's plan to reduce 2026 nickel production to 250 million tonnes. This move is expected to bolster market sentiment amid oversupply concerns.

title: TECH Project high-grade nickel is primed to fuel the global green transition
summary: Queensland Pacific Metals’ TECH Project aims to become the world’s premier source of high-grade, ethically derived nickel for electric vehicles and green energy. It features the innovative DNi Process, which extracts nickel and cobalt from laterite ore with over 98% nitric acid recycling, no tailings dams, and minimal waste, making it a carbon-negative facility. General Motors has secured an option to purchase the project's uncommitted nickel and cobalt production for the first 15 years.

title: Recycling technology achieves 99% purity of nickel and cobalt
summary: A UNIST research team developed an innovative recycling technology recovering over 95% of nickel and cobalt from waste batteries with 99%+ purity using selective electrochemical separation and a multifunctional deep eutectic solvent. This method avoids complex chemicals and wastewater, with in-situ self-purification and solvent reusability over four cycles. Published in Energy Storage Materials, it offers a sustainable solution for battery recycling.

title: CVA and Cogne Acciai Speciali sign Energy Release contract; CVA to build four photovoltaic plants in Sicily
summary: CVA Group and Cogne Acciai Speciali signed an Energy Release contract under which CVA will construct four photovoltaic plants in Sicily (total capacity >20 MW) and advance electricity to CAS under Italy’s Energy Release scheme; the arrangement supports CAS’s decarbonisation and aligns with regional and EU energy goals.[1]
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Cogne Acciai Speciali: 94% of energy used comes from renewable sources and 93% of employees have permanent contracts
summary: In its 2024 sustainability report, Cogne Acciai Speciali reported that over 94% of the Group's electricity consumption came from certified renewable sources and highlighted strong social performance with more than 93% of employees on permanent contracts, underscoring the company’s sustainability and workforce stability progress.[6]
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Cogne Acciai Speciali launches pilot phase of green hydrogen project
summary: Cogne initiated the pilot phase of its 'Green Hydrogen in Cogne' project at the Aosta plant using a 1.008 MW AEM electrolyzer to produce green hydrogen (approx. 165 tons/year) with the aim to power one furnace and reduce CO2 emissions; the project is supported by €7.9 million from Italy’s NRRP.[4]
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Cogne invests in Aosta plant (cooling chamber revamp)
summary: Cogne Acciai Speciali is modernising its Aosta plant by revamping the cooling chamber of the continuous casting machine for special steel blooms to improve efficiency and maintenance; the upgrade is part of wider investments by Walsin Lihwa into the plant and aligns with the group’s expansion strategy in Europe and Asia.[2]
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Cogne Acciai Speciali embarks on ResponsibleSteel™ certification for Aosta site
summary: Cogne announced it has started the process to obtain ResponsibleSteel™ certification for its Aosta site, formalising its sustainability commitments across the steel production value chain and reinforcing investments in responsible practices and stakeholder value creation.[8]
